info.title: Databricks Dashboards API (workspace)
info.description: OpenAPI specification for the Databricks dashboards service (workspace-level APIs), generated from the Databricks Python SDK.

post.summary: Create new message in a [conversation](:method:genie/startconversation). The AI response uses all
post.description:
Create new message in a [conversation](:method:genie/startconversation). The AI response uses all
previously created messages in the conversation to respond.

:param space_id: str
  The ID associated with the Genie space where the conversation is started.
:param conversation_id: str
  The ID associated with the conversation.
:param content: str
  User message content.

:returns:
  Long-running operation waiter for :class:`GenieMessage`.
  See :method:wait_get_message_genie_completed for more details.

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: The ID associated with the Genie space where the conversation is started.

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: The ID associated with the conversation.

get.description:
List messages in a conversation

:param page_size: int (optional)
  Maximum number of messages to return per page
:param page_token: str (optional)
  Token to get the next page of results

:returns: :class:`GenieListConversationMessagesResponse`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return per page

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token to get the next page of results

post.summary: Creates a Genie space from a serialized payload.
post.description:
Creates a Genie space from a serialized payload.

:param warehouse_id: str
  Warehouse to associate with the new space
:param serialized_space: str
  The contents of the Genie Space in serialized string form. Use the [Get Genie
  Space](:method:genie/getspace) API to retrieve an example response, which includes the
  `serialized_space` field. This field provides the structure of the JSON string that represents the
  space's layout and components.
:param description: str (optional)
  Optional description
:param parent_path: str (optional)
  Parent folder path where the space will be registered
:param title: str (optional)
  Optional title override

:returns: :class:`GenieSpace`

warehouse_id.description: Warehouse to associate with the new space

serialized_space.description: The contents of the Genie Space in serialized string form. Use the [Get Genie Space](:method:genie/getspace) API to retrieve an example response, which includes the `serialized_space` field. This field provides the structure of the JSON string that represents the space's layout and components.

parent_path.description: Parent folder path where the space will be registered

Get list of Genie Spaces.

:param page_size: int (optional)

:returns: :class:`GenieListSpacesResponse`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Maximum number of spaces to return per page

parameters.name: page_token

post.summary: Initiates a new SQL execution and returns a `download_id` and `download_id_signature` that you can use
post.description:
Initiates a new SQL execution and returns a `download_id` and `download_id_signature` that you can use
to track the progress of the download. The query result is stored in an external link and can be
retrieved using the [Get Download Full Query Result](:method:genie/getdownloadfullqueryresult) API.
Both `download_id` and `download_id_signature` must be provided when calling the Get endpoint.

----

### **Warning: Databricks strongly recommends that you protect the URLs that are returned by the
`EXTERNAL_LINKS` disposition.**

When you use the `EXTERNAL_LINKS` disposition, a short-lived, URL is generated, which can be used to
download the results directly from . As a short-lived is embedded in this URL, you should protect the
URL.

Because URLs are already generated with embedded temporary s, you must not set an `Authorization`
header in the download requests.

See [Execute Statement](:method:statementexecution/executestatement) for more details.

----

:param space_id: str
  Genie space ID
:param conversation_id: str
  Conversation ID
:param message_id: str
  Message ID
:param attachment_id: str
  Attachment ID

:returns: :class:`GenieGenerateDownloadFullQueryResultResponse`

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: Genie space ID

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: Conversation ID

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Message ID

parameters.name: attachment_id
parameters.description: Attachment ID

get.summary: After [Generating a Full Query Result Download](:method:genie/generatedownloadfullqueryresult) and
get.description:
After [Generating a Full Query Result Download](:method:genie/generatedownloadfullqueryresult) and
successfully receiving a `download_id` and `download_id_signature`, use this API to poll the download
progress. Both `download_id` and `download_id_signature` are required to call this endpoint. When the
download is complete, the API returns the result in the `EXTERNAL_LINKS` disposition, containing one
or more external links to the query result files.

----

### **Warning: Databricks strongly recommends that you protect the URLs that are returned by the
`EXTERNAL_LINKS` disposition.**

When you use the `EXTERNAL_LINKS` disposition, a short-lived, URL is generated, which can be used to
download the results directly from . As a short-lived is embedded in this URL, you should protect the
URL.

Because URLs are already generated with embedded temporary s, you must not set an `Authorization`
header in the download requests.

See [Execute Statement](:method:statementexecution/executestatement) for more details.

----

:param space_id: str
  Genie space ID
:param conversation_id: str
  Conversation ID
:param message_id: str
  Message ID
:param attachment_id: str
  Attachment ID
:param download_id: str
  Download ID. This ID is provided by the [Generate Download
  endpoint](:method:genie/generateDownloadFullQueryResult)
:param download_id_signature: str (optional)
  JWT signature for the download_id to ensure secure access to query results

:returns: :class:`GenieGetDownloadFullQueryResultResponse`

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: Genie space ID

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: Conversation ID

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Message ID

parameters.name: attachment_id
parameters.description: Attachment ID

parameters.name: download_id
parameters.description: Download ID. This ID is provided by the [Generate Download endpoint](:method:genie/generateDownloadFullQueryResult)

parameters.name: download_id_signature
parameters.description: JWT signature for the download_id to ensure secure access to query results

get.summary: Get the result of SQL query if the message has a query attachment. This is only available if a message
get.description:
Get the result of SQL query if the message has a query attachment. This is only available if a message
has a query attachment and the message status is `EXECUTING_QUERY` OR `COMPLETED`.

:param space_id: str
  Genie space ID
:param conversation_id: str
  Conversation ID
:param message_id: str
  Message ID
:param attachment_id: str
  Attachment ID

:returns: :class:`GenieGetMessageQueryResultResponse`

parameters.description: Genie space ID

parameters.name: conversation_id
parameters.description: Conversation ID

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: Message ID

parameters.name: attachment_id
parameters.description: Attachment ID

patch.summary: Updates a Genie space with a serialized payload.
patch.description:
Updates a Genie space with a serialized payload.

:param space_id: str
  Genie space ID
:param description: str (optional)
  Optional description
:param serialized_space: str (optional)
  The contents of the Genie Space in serialized string form (full replacement). Use the [Get Genie
  Space](:method:genie/getspace) API to retrieve an example response, which includes the
  `serialized_space` field. This field provides the structure of the JSON string that represents the
  space's layout and components.
:param title: str (optional)
  Optional title override
:param warehouse_id: str (optional)
  Optional warehouse override

:returns: :class:`GenieSpace`

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: Genie space ID

serialized_space.description: The contents of the Genie Space in serialized string form (full replacement). Use the [Get Genie Space](:method:genie/getspace) API to retrieve an example response, which includes the `serialized_space` field. This field provides the structure of the JSON string that represents the space's layout and components.

get.summary: Get a list of conversations in a Genie Space.
get.description:
Get a list of conversations in a Genie Space.

:param space_id: str
  The ID of the Genie space to retrieve conversations from.
:param include_all: bool (optional)
  Include all conversations in the space across all users. Requires at least CAN MANAGE permission on
  the space.
:param page_size: int (optional)
  Maximum number of conversations to return per page
:param page_token: str (optional)
  Token to get the next page of results

:returns: :class:`GenieListConversationsResponse`

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: The ID of the Genie space to retrieve conversations from.

parameters.name: include_all
parameters.description: Include all conversations in the space across all users. Requires at least CAN MANAGE permission on the space.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Maximum number of conversations to return per page

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token to get the next page of results

post.description:
Create a draft dashboard.

:param dashboard: :class:`Dashboard`
:param dataset_catalog: str (optional)
  Sets the default catalog for all datasets in this dashboard. Does not impact table references that
  use fully qualified catalog names (ex: samples.nyctaxi.trips). Leave blank to keep each dataset’s
  existing configuration.
:param dataset_schema: str (optional)
  Sets the default schema for all datasets in this dashboard. Does not impact table references that
  use fully qualified schema names (ex: nyctaxi.trips). Leave blank to keep each dataset’s existing
  configuration.

:returns: :class:`Dashboard`

parameters.name: dataset_schema
parameters.description: Sets the default schema for all datasets in this dashboard. Does not impact table references that use fully qualified schema names (ex: nyctaxi.trips). Leave blank to keep each dataset’s existing configuration.

dashboard.description: :param dataset_catalog: str (optional) Sets the default catalog for all datasets in this dashboard. Does not impact table references that use fully qualified catalog names (ex: samples.nyctaxi.trips). Leave blank to keep each dataset’s existing configuration.

get.description:
List dashboards.

:param page_size: int (optional)
  The number of dashboards to return per page.
:param page_token: str (optional)
  A page token, received from a previous `ListDashboards` call. This token can be used to retrieve the
  subsequent page.
:param show_trashed: bool (optional)
  The flag to include dashboards located in the trash. If unspecified, only active dashboards will be
  returned.
:param view: :class:`DashboardView` (optional)
  `DASHBOARD_VIEW_BASIC`only includes summary metadata from the dashboard.

:returns: Iterator over :class:`Dashboard`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of dashboards to return per page.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: A page token, received from a previous `ListDashboards` call. This token can be used to retrieve the subsequent page.

parameters.name: show_trashed
parameters.description: The flag to include dashboards located in the trash. If unspecified, only active dashboards will be returned.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: `DASHBOARD_VIEW_BASIC`only includes summary metadata from the dashboard.

get.description:
Get the current published dashboard.

:param dashboard_id: str
  UUID identifying the published dashboard.

:returns: :class:`PublishedDashboard`

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: UUID identifying the published dashboard.

post.description:
Publish the current draft dashboard.

:param dashboard_id: str
  UUID identifying the dashboard to be published.
:param embed_credentials: bool (optional)
  Flag to indicate if the publisher's credentials should be embedded in the published dashboard. These
  embedded credentials will be used to execute the published dashboard's queries.
:param warehouse_id: str (optional)
  The ID of the warehouse that can be used to override the warehouse which was set in the draft.

:returns: :class:`PublishedDashboard`

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: UUID identifying the dashboard to be published.

embed_credentials.description: Flag to indicate if the publisher's credentials should be embedded in the published dashboard. These embedded credentials will be used to execute the published dashboard's queries.

warehouse_id.description: The ID of the warehouse that can be used to override the warehouse which was set in the draft.

delete.description:
Unpublish the dashboard.

:param dashboard_id: str
  UUID identifying the published dashboard.

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: UUID identifying the published dashboard.

post.summary: Migrates a classic SQL dashboard to Lakeview.
post.description:
Migrates a classic SQL dashboard to Lakeview.

:param source_dashboard_id: str
  UUID of the dashboard to be migrated.
:param display_name: str (optional)
  Display name for the new Lakeview dashboard.
:param parent_path: str (optional)
  The workspace path of the folder to contain the migrated Lakeview dashboard.
:param update_parameter_syntax: bool (optional)
  Flag to indicate if mustache parameter syntax ({{ param }}) should be auto-updated to named syntax
  (:param) when converting datasets in the dashboard.

:returns: :class:`Dashboard`

source_dashboard_id.description: UUID of the dashboard to be migrated.

display_name.description: Display name for the new Lakeview dashboard.

parent_path.description: The workspace path of the folder to contain the migrated Lakeview dashboard.

update_parameter_syntax.description: Flag to indicate if mustache parameter syntax ({{ param }}) should be auto-updated to named syntax (:param) when converting datasets in the dashboard.

get.summary: Get a required authorization details and scopes of a published dashboard to mint an OAuth token.
get.description:
Get a required authorization details and scopes of a published dashboard to mint an OAuth token.

:param dashboard_id: str
  UUID identifying the published dashboard.
:param external_value: str (optional)
  Provided external value to be included in the custom claim.
:param external_viewer_id: str (optional)
  Provided external viewer id to be included in the custom claim.

:returns: :class:`GetPublishedDashboardTokenInfoResponse`

parameters.name: dashboard_id
parameters.description: UUID identifying the published dashboard.

parameters.name: external_value
parameters.description: Provided external value to be included in the custom claim.

parameters.name: external_viewer_id
parameters.description: Provided external viewer id to be included in the custom claim.

resource_legacy_acl_path.description: The acl path of the tree store resource resource.

resource_name.description: The resource name to which the authorization rule applies. This field is specific to `workspace_rule_set` constraint. Format: `workspaces/{workspace_id}/dashboards/{dashboard_id}`

type.description: The type of authorization downscoping policy. Ex: `workspace_rule_set` defines access rules for a specific workspace resource

timezone_id.description: A Java timezone id. The schedule will be resolved with respect to this timezone. See [Java TimeZone] for details. [Java TimeZone]: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/TimeZone.html

display_name.description: The display name of the dashboard.

etag.description: The etag for the dashboard. Can be optionally provided on updates to ensure that the dashboard has not been modified since the last read. This field is excluded in List Dashboards responses.

lifecycle_state.description: The state of the dashboard resource. Used for tracking trashed status.

parent_path.description: The workspace path of the folder containing the dashboard. Includes leading slash and no trailing slash. This field is excluded in List Dashboards responses.

path.description: The workspace path of the dashboard asset, including the file name. Exported dashboards always have the file extension `.lvdash.json`. This field is excluded in List Dashboards responses.

serialized_dashboard.description: The contents of the dashboard in serialized string form. This field is excluded in List Dashboards responses. Use the [get dashboard API] to retrieve an example response, which includes the `serialized_dashboard` field. This field provides the structure of the JSON string that represents the dashboard's layout and components. [get dashboard API]: https://docs.databricks.com/api/workspace/lakeview/get

update_time.description: The timestamp of when the dashboard was last updated by the user. This field is excluded in List Dashboards responses.

warehouse_id.description: The warehouse ID used to run the dashboard.

query.description: Query Attachment if Genie responds with a SQL query

text.description: Text Attachment if Genie responds with text. This also contains the final summary when available.

user_id.description: ID of the user who created the conversation

created_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the message was created

last_updated_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the message was last updated

GenieFeedback.description: Feedback containing rating and optional comment

download_id_signature.description: JWT signature for the download_id to ensure secure access to query results

next_page_token.description: The token to use for retrieving the next page of results.
Token to get the next page of results

created_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the message was created

error.description: Error message if Genie failed to respond to the message

feedback.description: User feedback for the message if provided

last_updated_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the message was last updated

query_result.description: The result of SQL query if the message includes a query attachment. Deprecated. Use `query_result_metadata` in `GenieQueryAttachment` instead.

user_id.description: ID of the user who created the message

last_updated_timestamp.description: Time when the user updated the query last

query_result_metadata.description: Metadata associated with the query result.

statement_id.description: Statement Execution API statement id. Use [Get status, manifest, and result first chunk](:method:statementexecution/getstatement) to get the full result data.

row_count.description: The number of rows in the result set.

serialized_space.description: The contents of the Genie Space in serialized string form. This field is excluded in List Genie spaces responses. Use the [Get Genie Space](:method:genie/getspace) API to retrieve an example response, which includes the `serialized_space` field. This field provides the structure of the JSON string that represents the space's layout and components.

warehouse_id.description: Warehouse associated with the Genie Space

custom_claim.description: Custom claim generated from external_value and external_viewer_id. Format: `urn:aibi:external_data:<external_value>:<external_viewer_id>:<dashboard_id>`

next_page_token.description: A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent dashboards.

embed_credentials.description: Indicates whether credentials are embedded in the published dashboard.

revision_create_time.description: The timestamp of when the published dashboard was last revised.

warehouse_id.description: The warehouse ID used to run the published dashboard.

statement_id.description: Statement Execution API statement id. Use [Get status, manifest, and result first chunk](:method:statementexecution/getstatement) to get the full result data.

statement_id_signature.description: JWT corresponding to the statement contained in this result

create_time.description: A timestamp indicating when the schedule was created.

dashboard_id.description: UUID identifying the dashboard to which the schedule belongs.

etag.description: The etag for the schedule. Must be left empty on create, must be provided on updates to ensure that the schedule has not been modified since the last read, and can be optionally provided on delete.

pause_status.description: The status indicates whether this schedule is paused or not.

update_time.description: A timestamp indicating when the schedule was last updated.

warehouse_id.description: The warehouse id to run the dashboard with for the schedule.

user_subscriber.description: The user to receive the subscription email. This parameter is mutually exclusive with `destination_subscriber`.

create_time.description: A timestamp indicating when the subscription was created.

created_by_user_id.description: UserId of the user who adds subscribers (users or notification destinations) to the dashboard's schedule.

dashboard_id.description: UUID identifying the dashboard to which the subscription belongs.

etag.description: The etag for the subscription. Must be left empty on create, can be optionally provided on delete to ensure that the subscription has not been deleted since the last read.

schedule_id.description: UUID identifying the schedule to which the subscription belongs.

update_time.description: A timestamp indicating when the subscription was last updated.

DashboardView.description:
Create a collection of name/value pairs.

Example enumeration:

>>> class Color(Enum):
...     RED = 1
...     BLUE = 2
...     GREEN = 3

Access them by:

- attribute access::

>>> Color.RED
<Color.RED: 1>

- value lookup:

>>> Color(1)
<Color.RED: 1>

- name lookup:

>>> Color['RED']
<Color.RED: 1>

Enumerations can be iterated over, and know how many members they have:

>>> len(Color)
3

>>> list(Color)
[<Color.RED: 1>, <Color.BLUE: 2>, <Color.GREEN: 3>]

Methods can be added to enumerations, and members can have their own
attributes -- see the documentation for details.

MessageStatus.description:
MessageStatus. The possible values are: * `FETCHING_METADATA`: Fetching metadata from the data
sources. * `FILTERING_CONTEXT`: Running smart context step to determine relevant context. *
`ASKING_AI`: Waiting for the LLM to respond to the user's question. * `PENDING_WAREHOUSE`:
Waiting for warehouse before the SQL query can start executing. * `EXECUTING_QUERY`: Executing a
generated SQL query. Get the SQL query result by calling
[getMessageAttachmentQueryResult](:method:genie/getMessageAttachmentQueryResult) API. *
`FAILED`: The response generation or query execution failed. See `error` field. * `COMPLETED`:
Message processing is completed. Results are in the `attachments` field. Get the SQL query
result by calling
[getMessageAttachmentQueryResult](:method:genie/getMessageAttachmentQueryResult) API. *
`SUBMITTED`: Message has been submitted. * `QUERY_RESULT_EXPIRED`: SQL result is not available
anymore. The user needs to rerun the query. Rerun the SQL query result by calling
[executeMessageAttachmentQuery](:method:genie/executeMessageAttachmentQuery) API. * `CANCELLED`:
Message has been cancelled.
